fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32036].
  {panel}

The Inline Edit feature in JIRA is beneficial, but is incomplete.  The current functionality edits and saves each field individually as it is edited, and the edit is triggered via a single click which results in unanticipated changes to fields and user confusion.

My Suggestion to resolve this is as follows:
# Enter Inline Edit mode by double clicking on a field that can be edited.
# Once in Inline Edit mode, allow subsequent fields to be edited via a single click.
# Once editing is complete, user must click a Save button on the issue to commit all changes at the same time.

These changes will prevent users from accidentally changing fields on an issue while still keeping it easy to change multiple fields.  Then the single Save button which will commit all changes will then also prevent multiple Issue Updated Events from being triggered and flooding users with emails.  This also has some added benefits such as allowing plugins the ability to tap into that save function in order to validate fields and also enable field dependencies.

Please vote!
fields.summary: Inline edit behavior enhancements

fields.description:
In JIRA Events page, the drop down box, there are two options for _Issue Updated_ that is mapped to different template ids:

!Screen Shot 2013-03-08 at 3.32.33 PM.png!

And if you create two Events using the first and after the second, you can't tell the difference in JIRA:

!Screen Shot 2013-03-08 at 3.34.32 PM.png!

But they will be mapped to different templates in the database:
{noformat}
mysql> select * from jiraeventtype where name like '%severity%';
+-------+-------------+------------+-------------+------------+
| ID    | TEMPLATE_ID | NAME       | DESCRIPTION | event_type |
+-------+-------------+------------+-------------+------------+
| 10000 |          17 | Severity 0 |             | NULL       |
| 10001 |           2 | Severity 1 |             | NULL       |
+-------+-------------+------------+-------------+------------+
2 rows in set (0.00 sec)
{noformat}
And looking at the {{email-template-id-mappings.xml}} they are both set to the same event type:

{noformat}
    <templatemapping id="2">
        <name>Issue Updated</name>
        <template>issueupdated.vm</template>
        <templatetype>issueevent</templatetype>
    </templatemapping>
	
    <templatemapping id="17">
        <name>Issue Updated</name>
        <template>issueupdated.vm</template>
        <templatetype>issueevent</templatetype>
    </templatemapping>
{noformat}
fields.summary: Issue Updated Event is duplicated

fields.description:
h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Set the current default language in {{JIRA Administration >> General Configuration}} to English
# Create an issue in a test project, and set the due date to anytime around March (any year). Then resolve the issue
# Check the XML of the said issue with the Issue Navigator. This is what you get (expected):
{code}
<created>Thu, 16 Aug 2012 23:49:30 +0800</created><updated>Fri, 8 Mar 2013 18:01:33 +0800</updated><resolved>Fri, 8 Mar 2013 18:01:33 +0800</resolved><due>Fri, 15 Mar 2013 00:00:00 +0800</due>
{code}
# Now, change the System Default language to German, and this is what you will get (not expected):
{code}
<created>Thu, 16 Aug 2012 23:49:30 +0800</created><updated>Fri, 8 Mar 2013 18:01:33 +0800</updated><resolved>Fri, 8 Mar 2013 18:01:33 +0800</resolved><due>Fr, 15 Mrz 2013 00:00:00 +0800</due>
{code}

Only the due date is changed to German. The rest remains in English. The same behavior is observed with French as well. 

This is causing JSONExceptions in Confluence's JIRA Issues Macro. 
!json.png!

h3.Resolution
Upgrade to JIRA 5.1 and above, where the issue no longer appears. (All date fields are updated to the correct language)
fields.summary: Created, Updated, and Resolved Datetime Field Format does not follow the System Default Language in XML

	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:76)
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:39)
	at webwork.interceptor.NestedInterceptorChain.proceed(NestedInterceptorChain.java:31)
	at webwork.interceptor.ChainedInterceptor.intercept(ChainedInterceptor.java:16)

	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:143)

	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:717)

{noformat}

This guy is caused by notifications - specifically an object is created for a user, then the checkNotNull() method is run on it. It generates a NPE as a check if it's null or not, rather than an NPE being generated later without any reason why. When the the deactivate users functionality was written this bug was addressed. This issue is a placeholder to publicly track that it has been fixed.

It can be caused by the following:

* Using an email address in notifications instead of a user. They have default notifications, so unfortunately this isn't the case.
* A user may have been deleted from their Active Directory and no longer exists within the database, yet is still a reporter, watcher or assignee of an issue.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31992].
  {panel}

Jira issues can have non UTF-8 content in summary and description fields. 

When requesting these issues via the Jira REST API, the returned content is non UTF-8 encoded. 
However, the Content-Type response header always specifies the content as 'application/json;charset=UTF-8'

The Content-Type response header in the REST API should match the actual encoding of the content and vice versa.
fields.summary: JIRA REST API - Actual content encoding does not match response Content-Type

fields.description:
I have a few question about JIRA integration with active directory. This is non production system & we are using the default database HSQL DB. The version of JIRA is 5.0 (JIRA (v5.0#713-sha1:aec58e2)).
I have dedicated user & password to access the LDAP. When we enable the active directory, JIRA reads all the AD users & loads it to active cache. It takes about 22 min (1354 sec) to fetch all 55000 odd records. The application is very slow during the process of syntonization. 
Here are my questions
1. In general do you know if you login to JIRA with your AD credential does JIRA goes to LDAP & authenticates the user or does it authenticate against the active cache that it holds (copy of LDAP).
2. There is an attribute : "directory.cache.synchronise.interval": "3600" that defines the synchronize interval. How can I change synchronise interval to 1 day.
3. How can we increase the size of active cache

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The [JIRA Configuration Tool|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+JIRA+Configuration+Tool] allows you to set a Validation Query Timeout for DBMS other than MySQL. This can cause exceptions with JIRA and prevent it from starting up at all using PostgreSQL.

h3. Environment

* Mac OS X
* PostgreSQL 9.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open up the [JIRA Configuration Tool|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+JIRA+Configuration+Tool].
# Set up a database connection for PostgreSQL.
# Enter the Validation Query Timeout and save.
# Start up JIRA.

h3. Expected Results

The Config Tool prevents setting this field for PostgreSQL (and potentially other databases).

h3. Actual Results

JIRA starts up and throws the below exception:

{noformat}

2013-03-04 17:12:35,864 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [NoModule] Error getting datasource via DBCP: JdbcDatasourceInfo{uri='jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/jiradb600', driverClassName='org.postgresql.Driver', username='jiradbuser', password='********', isolationLevel='null', connectionProperties=null, connectionPoolInfo=ConnectionPoolInfo{maxSize=20, minSize=20, initialSize=null, maxIdle=20, maxWait=30000, sleepTime=300000, lifeTime=600000, deadLockMaxWait=600000, deadLockRetryWait=10000, validationQuery='select version();', minEvictableTimeMillis=60000, timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis=300000, poolPreparedStatements=null, testOnBorrow=null, testOnReturn=null, testWhileIdle=true, maxOpenPreparedStatements=null, numTestsPerEvictionRun=null, removeAbandonedTimeout=300, validationQueryTimeout=3, defaultCatalog=null}}
org.apache.commons.dbcp.SQLNestedException: Cannot create PoolableConnectionFactory (Method org.postgresql.jdbc4.Jdbc4Statement.setQueryTimeout(int) is not yet implemented.)
    at org.apache.commons.dbcp.BasicDataSource.createPoolableConnectionFactory(BasicDataSource.java:1549)
    at org.apache.commons.dbcp.BasicDataSource.createDataSource(BasicDataSource.java:1388)
    at org.apache.commons.dbcp.BasicDataSource.setLogWriter(BasicDataSource.java:1134)
    ...
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: Method org.postgresql.jdbc4.Jdbc4Statement.setQueryTimeout(int) is not yet implemented.
    at org.postgresql.Driver.notImplemented(Driver.java:753)
    at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.setQueryTimeout(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:656)
    at org.apache.commons.dbcp.DelegatingStatement.setQueryTimeout(DelegatingStatement.java:249)
{noformat}

h3. Notes

Behaviour is documented in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Cannot+Access+Database+due+to+org.postgresql.jdbc4.Jdbc4Statement.setQueryTimeout%28int%29+is+not+yet+implemented
fields.summary: The JIRA Configuration Tool allows setting of a Validation Query Timeout that can cause exceptions

*Reproduction Steps*
* For an OnDemand instance (with Giffy for JIRA 3.8), set its license to a license key which does not allow users to use Gliffy
* Hit URL https://<hostname>/rest/ondemand/license/latest/license/load, to force the license to propogate
* As admin, go to https://<hostname>/secure/admin/GliffyLicenseAction.jspa

*What Happens*
* Gliffy for JIRA OnDemand license type information is displayed incorrectly

!gliffy_invalid_license.png!

From the above scenario, the license information should be displayed as "Atlassian OnDemand License (Inactive)".

This is a *regression* from Gliffy for JIRA version 3.7.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31979].
  {panel}

h4. Use case
# An LDAP user directory in JIRA is created with 'Read Only with Local Groups'
# An LDAP user is then placed in a local group, e.g. 'jira-users'
# Later, it is decided that this group's memberships will be handled in LDAP, and a group of the same name is created (again for example 'jira-users')

The result is that the LDAP 'jira-users' members never get synced over since there's already an existing local group of the same name that contained at least one LDAP member at some point in time.

h4. Purpose
The purpose of this improvement request is to investigate a way allow the LDAP group to override the local group in this senario. In the mean time, there's a workaround, detailed below.

h4. Workaround
When the LDAP user is placed in the local group, a new row will be created in the _cwd_group_ table associating the local group with the _directory_id_ of the LDAP user directory. The row will have the _local_ column set to '1' indicating that it is not a group from LDAP.

This flag, when set to '1', apparently keeps the LDAP group of the same name from syncing.

# Shut down JIRA
# Update the row such that the _local_ column is set to '0'
# Start JIRA, which will trigger a sync on startup

Please note the impact this will have on your user memberships:
* Local users and groups are not affected
* LDAP users in the local group will no longer have that membership relationship
* LDAP users will now belong in the LDAP group of the same name
fields.summary: Investigate a way to override local groups with LDAP groups of the same name when using 'Read Only with Local Groups'

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

<customfield id="customfield_10930" key="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:multiversion">
<customfieldname>Target Release</customfieldname>
<customfieldvalues>
<customfieldvalue>36029</customfieldvalue>
</customfieldvalues>
</customfield>

As a result, the issue macro display result of Target Release as 36029 instead of 13.04


*Steps to Reproduce*
* Create a custom field in JIRA that deals with versions (either 'Version Picker' or 'Multi Version Picker')
* Open any ticket and try to add these versions and put the values
* Use the JIRA XML API to get the value of these custom fields
* Expectation to see the values of these versions
* Actual, we only see the IDs of these versions

*Resolution* 
* This issue is resolved out of the box in Jira 8.0.0
* For Jira 7.13.x and 7.12.0, the dark feature outlined below will resolve the problem:
{panel:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ccc|titleBGColor=#a7c7f9|bgColor=#eff3f9}
# Navigate to https://<JiraBaseURL>/secure/admin/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa
# Next to Enable dark feature, paste: {code:xml}
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.export.xml.unified.enabled
{code} and click Add
# Verify that the Jira Issue/Filter shows the correct result
{panel}

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In previous version of JIRA, the database connection parameters were defined with JNDI location and from JIRA 4.4.x onwards, it's now stored into the {{dbconfig.xml}} file. See this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+4.4+Upgrade+Notes#JIRA4.4UpgradeNotes-DatabaseConfigurationChanges] for more details.

h3. The problem
While upgrading JIRA with the installer, the database parameters stored into the JNDI location are not converted automatically to the new standards ({{dbcomfig.xml}}), this causes the upgrade to fail. More details in this [KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Upgrading+JIRA+with+the+installer+throws+NullPointerException].

h3. Expected results
Instead of proposed solution in this other ticket [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/INST-453], which is a warn message mentioning the files that have customizations in it, the installer should convert the JNDI location to the new format and allow the upgrade to continue.
fields.summary: JNDI Database connection parameters aren't converted while upgrading JIRA with the installer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31971].
  {panel}

TL;DR: JIC needs a "scalable" mode where collectors can be deployed into tens of thousands of websites without crashing the JIRA instance hosting JIC. And neither should JIC represent a single point of failure for those other websites.

When JIC has a "scalable" mode, we have to update the jira-feedback-plugin in JIRA to use that mode.

----
I'm currently investigating performance issues on JAC and the issue collector is causing quite a bit of overhead. (https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/ADM-33614)

In particular the request for /rest/collectors/1.0/configuration/trigger/d3de7fb5 (which any client with an issue collector will send) causes quite a bit of load on the server hosting issue collectors.

When this resource is hit it causes DB lookups:
{noformat}

	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor277.invoke(Unknown Source)

	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at com.atlassian.sal.jira.pluginsettings.LazyProjectMigratingPropertySet$PropertySetInvocationHandler.invoke(LazyProjectMigratingPropertySet.java:57)
	at $Proxy1841.getType(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.sal.jira.pluginsettings.JiraPluginSettings.getActual(JiraPluginSettings.java:47)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.pluginsettings.AbstractStringPluginSettings.get(AbstractStringPluginSettings.java:126)
	at com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.components.CollectorStoreImpl.getCollector(CollectorStoreImpl.java:103)

	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$1.intercept(DispatchProviderHelper.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DefaultMethodInvocation.invoke(DefaultMethodInvocation.java:61)

	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper.invokeMethodWithInterceptors(DispatchProviderHelper.java:132)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$ResponseOutInvoker._dispatch(DispatchProviderHelper.java:230)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.model.method.dispatch.ResourceJavaMethodDispatcher.dispatch(ResourceJavaMethodDispatcher.java:75)

	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.uri.rules.RightHandPathRule.accept(RightHandPathRule.java:147)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.uri.rules.ResourceClassRule.accept(ResourceClassRule.java:108)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.uri.rules.RightHandPathRule.accept(RightHandPathRule.java:147)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.uri.rules.RootResourceClassesRule.accept(RootResourceClassesRule.java:84)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl._handleRequest(WebApplicationImpl.java:1469)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl._handleRequest(WebApplicationImpl.java:1400)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl.handleRequest(WebApplicationImpl.java:1349)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl.handleRequest(WebApplicationImp
{noformat}

Also the response is returned with no-cache headers:
{noformat}Cache-Control:no-cache, no-store, no-transform{noformat}

This means that if an issue collector is enabled in OnDemand for example, every single OnDemand user will trigger a request to JAC for every single page-pop which will potentially hit the DB if the propertysets aren't cached in memory.

I think we should consider:
* Moving issue collectors to ActiveObjects which may be more efficient than the currently ugly pluginsettings storage (where everything is split across multiple DB rows)
* Adding temporary cache headers to this response so not every single end-user page-pop hits JAC.  I think we don't have cache headers to allow editing of collectors, but surely several hours to see edits on the client is acceptable for a feature like this.

Effectively the issue collector in OnDemand is launching a DDOS attack on JAC currently.
fields.summary: Issue collector causes performance issues on host JIRA instance

fields.description:
When running the access log analyzer, it throws the following error:

{quote}


    Error parsing access_log.2012-07-03 at line 99 : Unable to find request date/tim
    e in chunk before request.
    --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    10.66.49.57 818x100x2 - [03/Jul/2012:13:38:27 +0800] "GET /s/620/1/3.0.2/_/downl
    oad/batch/com.atlassian.gadgets.dashboard:gadget-dashboard-resources/com.atlassi
    an.gadgets.dashboard:gadget-dashboard-resources.js HTTP/1.1" 200 4566 3 "http://
    10.66.49.57:8010/secure/Dashboard.jspa" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1
    ; en-US) AppleWebKit/532.5 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/4.1.249.1064 Safari/532.5"
    "1xdtf5a"
    --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    Error parsing access_log.2012-07-03 at line 100 : Unable to find request date/ti
    me in chunk before request.
    --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    10.66.49.57 818x101x2 - [03/Jul/2012:13:38:27 +0800] "GET /s/620/1/5.6.8/_/downl
    oad/batch/com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-globalkeyboardshortcuts/com.pyxis.greenh
    opper.jira:gh-globalkeyboardshortcuts.js HTTP/1.1" 200 944 12 "http://10.66.49.5
    7:8010/secure/Dashboard.jspa" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US) A
    ppleWebKit/532.5 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/4.1.249.1064 Safari/532.5" "1xdtf5a"

    --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    Too many parse errors: 100
    Unable to parse at least one file: analysis aborted.

    {quote}

The above is caused by the *RequestLogParser.java:136* below:

{code}private final static DateFormat DATE_FORMAT = new SimpleDateFormat("dd/MMM/yyyy:HH:mm:ss");{code}

This code will throw an exception in non-us OS system, eg, Chinese Windows7 system.

This code can be used as *temporary* fix:

{code}private final static DateFormat DATE_FORMAT = new SimpleDateFormat("dd/MMM/yyyy:HH:mm:ss", Locale.US);{code}

(!) All credits goes to our customer [~fukan] for reporting this out
fields.summary: Access log analyzer throwing "Unable to find request date/time in chunk before request" error due to non-US OS system

fields.description:
Some custom fields like "<input type="text" AUTOFOCUS onfocus=document.write(12*12)>" mentioned in the QA data add themselves again to the JQL when sorting.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add the custom field column like "<input type="text" AUTOFOCUS onfocus=document.write(12*12)>" to the issue navigator.
2. Perform a JQL search like "ORDER BY <input type="text" AUTOFOCUS onfocus=document.write(12*12)> ASC"
3. Click on the custom field header to reverse the sort.

The Custom Field's Key "cf[12345]" gets added to the JQL and hence complains about multiple use of same custom field.

The JQL now looks like "ORDER BY cf[12345] ASC, <input type="text" AUTOFOCUS onfocus=document.write(12*12)> ASC"


This issue is seen only for custom field which have these Special ASCII characters in them. Not a normal custom field name like "dlkfjlkfdsflj"
fields.summary: Some custom fields add themselves again to the JQL when sorting, hence breaking the JQL

Customer has two projects: DASH and AUT.

DASH has 260 issues AUT has 70 issues.

New bug in DASH becomes DASH-261. 

From the more actions, the customer moves DASH-261 to the AUT project. 

AUT-71 is created. 

New bug in DASH becomes DASH-262. 

The customer feels that the bug should be DASH-261, not DASH-262 since DASH-261 was moved to AUT-71.  

Auto incrementing was explained. However, the customer feels that auto incrementing tickets should be specific to each project. In other words, moving a ticket to another project would automatically free up and preserve that ID for the next bug. 

Cheers,
Jason | Atlassian

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31950].
  {panel}

If you delete a custom field from Jira which still is used in a post function of the workflow then this workflow post function cannot be edited anymore.
When performing the transition Jira will display the following error:
!1.png!

If the post function is set upon creation of a case then Jira will display the error but still create the case, the case will be in an incorrect workflow step.

The only way to remove the post function from the workflow is by generating an xml export, deleting the function from the code and re-import the workflow
(Needs to be done by support for OnDemand instances)
Example:
{noformat}
<function type="class">
<arg name="field.value">UEC_SI</arg>
<arg name="class.name">com.googlecode.jsu.workflow.function.UpdateIssueCustomFieldPostFunction</arg>
<arg name="field.name">customfield_10384</arg>
</function>
{noformat}
fields.summary: Do not allow deletion of custom field if used in a workflow post-function

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31945].
  {panel}

Create a project in JIRA called ABC.

Run the following Jelly script using the Jelly Runner:
{code:xml|title=Create a custom field|borderStyle=solid}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib">
    <jira:CreateCustomField fieldType="select" fieldScope="global" fieldName="Severity" searcher="multiselectsearcher" customFieldIdVar="custField">
        <jira:AddCustomFieldSelectValue value="Low"/>
        <jira:AddCustomFieldSelectValue value="Medium"/>
        <jira:AddCustomFieldSelectValue value="High"/>
    </jira:CreateCustomField>
    <jira:AddFieldToScreen screen="Default Screen" fieldId="${custField.getId()}"/>
</JiraJelly>
{code}

Now attempt to create a JIRA issue, setting the value of the Severity field:

{code:xml|title=Set the value of the custom field|borderStyle=solid}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib">
    <jira:CreateIssue project-key="ABC" summary="foo" issueType="Bug" reporter="admin">
        <jira:AddCustomFieldValue name="Severity" value="Medium"/>
    </jira:CreateIssue>
</JiraJelly>
{code}

The following error message appears:

{code:xml|title=Error message|borderStyle=solid}
Jelly script ran and produced the following messages.
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira='jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib'>
  <Error action='CreateIssueDetails'>
    <TagContents>(CreateIssue(summary=foo)(reporter=admin)(issuetype=1)(project-key=ABC)(priority=3)(issueType=Bug)(pid=10200)(customfield_10501=Medium))</TagContents>
    <ExecutedAs>user=admin</ExecutedAs>
    <ErrorMessage>
Result=input
customfield_10501: Invalid value 'Medium' passed for customfield 'Severity'. Allowed values are: 10103[Low], 10104[Medium], 10105[High], -1
</ErrorMessage>
  </Error>
  <Error action='CreateIssueDetails'>
    <TagContents>(CreateIssue(summary=foo)(reporter=admin)(issuetype=1)(project-key=PKZ)(priority=3)(issueType=Bug)(pid=10200)(customfield_10501=Medium))</TagContents>
    <ExecutedAs>user=admin</ExecutedAs>
    <ErrorMessage>
Result=input
Error for field "customfield_10501" : Invalid value 'Medium' passed for customfield 'Severity'. Allowed values are: 10103[Low], 10104[Medium], 10105[High], -1
</ErrorMessage>
  </Error>
</JiraJelly> 
{code}

It seems that the following statement can be executed successfully, but of course, you have to know which id to use.

{code:xml|title=Set a custom field by id|borderStyle=solid}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib">
    <jira:CreateIssue project-key="ABC" summary="foo" issueType="Bug" reporter="admin">
        <jira:AddCustomFieldValue name="Severity" value="10104"/>
    </jira:CreateIssue>
</JiraJelly>
{code}
fields.summary: Allow custom Select fields to be set by value (not just id)
Fixes required for JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions 2.5.5

fields.description:
"Mentions" don't seem to be working in my new Jira 5.2 installation.  If, in a comment, I type an '@' and begin typing a username, the drop-down does appear with a list of matching users.  Selecting a user changes the typed content to [~ username] (without the space).  Posting the comment, however, the [~ username] text does not change to a reference to the user and the intended user is not notified of the attempted mention.

Possibly worth noting, I have Crowd managing my users.
fields.summary: Mentions not working

fields.description:
For some values, JIRA loses precision (1 second) when converting a time in hours with decimal to seconds (value stored in the database).

For example, the value 576.18h is stored as 2074247 when it should be 2074248 instead.

h4. Workaround
Log your time using hours/minutes/seconds format. For examle: {{1h2d3s}}
fields.summary: JIRA losses precission in time (1s) when time specifien in hours in decimal format
Mail subscription should run based on the user's profile timezone instead of the system timezone

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

When the user tried to create a new issue from the Project Summary page, if the user clicks on 'Cancel', then the user would be redirected back to the dashboard instead of the Project Summary

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Select any project to enter the project summary screen
# Click "Create issue" 
# Issue form opens up 
# Click "Cancel" at the end. 
# Issue gets closed but user is redirected to dashboard

I have attached a screencast of this procedure to make it more convenient

h3. Other findings

This was tested in JIRA 4.4.5. In the newer versions, if from the project, the user cancels the issue creation from the pop-up, the user would still be in the Project Summary screen. However, if the user creates the issue in a new tab (not in the pop-up), the redirection would still occur
fields.summary: Redirected back to dashboard when cancelling an issue creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31934].
  {panel}

The week number on the Calender is shown incorrectly with 2 week number 1 if you change the default language to German, France and Spanish. Was able to recreate this on Chrome Browser.

Refer to the screenshot below:
!calendererror.jpg!

*Steps to reproduce*
# Add a date picker on the Default Screen
# Change to German Language as the default language
# View the calender and change to January (Januar)
# Notice that there are two week 1

Note: This behavior is not noticeable on Firefox (19.0) and Internet Explorer (10), only Chrome (25.0) are affected   

*Workaround*
# Look and Feel (g + g + Look and Feel) and scroll to the bottom, on the option Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker, change to yes.
# Change default language to English
fields.summary: Week Number in Calender Error for German, France and Spanish Default Language in Chrome Browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the Update Issue 'Time Spent' post-function, it fails without error and does nothing.

h3. Environment

* PostgreSQL 9.1
* Mac OS X

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Copy the default JIRA workflow.
# Edit a transition (such as start progress) to add an 'Update Issue Field' post-function, setting the Issue Field 'Time Spent' to 5m.
# Set up a workflow scheme for that issue and assign it to a project.
# Use the transition that that is supposed to set the time spent.

h3. Expected Results

This Issue Field is not available at all - setting it can mess up GreenHopper's time calculation.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens.

h3. Workaround
Disable legacy mode for time tracking.
fields.summary: Update Issue Field Post-Function using Time Spent does not work
